alert.note: Alert for Amite; Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Pike; Southern Hancock; Walthall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 4:27PM CST until January 16 at 9:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM TUESDAY TO 10 AM CST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, light freezing rain and freezing drizzle expected. Total ice accumulations of several hundredths of an inch. For the Wind Chill Advisories, very cold wind chills in the single digits expected. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Louisiana and southern Mississippi. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to 9 AM CST Tuesday. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to noon CST Tuesday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 PM Tuesday to 10 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Sidewalks and roads, particularly bridges, overpasses, and lesser traveled secondary roads, will become slippery. The hazardous conditions could impact the commute tonight and Tuesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light rain will change to freezing rain and freezing drizzle tonight as much colder air moves into the area. The changeover to freezing rain is expected to occur from northwest to southeast across Southwest Mississippi and the Baton Rouge area during the early to mid evening and the Southshore late this evening and overnight. Precipitation ends from west to east late tonight and early Tuesday morning, but remaining water on roads freezing icy roads are likely to continue into the morning commute as any remaining water on roads could quickly freezing.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Amite; Northern Hancock; Pearl River; Pike; Southern Hancock; Walthall
